intro: Craspedia richea var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine craspedia, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and sunny conditions. Its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in summer, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh mountainous environments.
